results.description:
The Storkbites meeting is from 11 AM until 1 PM at the Sharon Community Presbyterian Church at 522 Carnot Road in Moon Township. Each session of Storkbites includes 6 meetings with different topics at each meeting.

Meetings are led by Edith Davidson or Diana Cooper, who are nurses from the Maternal Child Health unit at Heritage Valley Sewickley. We are happy to include mothers and babies who delivered at other local hospitals.

Mothers with babies under one year of age are welcome to attend, even if you are unable to attend all the meetings. Both mother and child should be well. Feeding, changing and crying are all very normal at our meetings!!

For more information call             (412)[masked]

Hope to see you there!
results.how_to_find_us: The church is across from the Nissan dealer on University Blvd. and next to the tennis courts by the Moon Area Middle School. Park in the parking lot next to the tennis courts. There is a pink Storkbites sign on the door you should enter.
results.name: Storkbites Meeting

results.description:
The annual Three Rivers Arts Festival takes place during June 5-14, 2015 -- featuring many hundreds of visual artists, musicians, dance performers, etc. over a ten day period at dozens of locations throughout Point State Park, Gateway Center, and the Cultural District downtown.  With over 95 hours of programming and a variety of activities for people of all ages, there is something for everyone to enjoy! 

We should all remember that people have different work schedules and commuting times to downtown, so not everyone can arrive at exactly the same time. So we'll incorporate some flexibility in choosing some festival activities and times for meeting on various festival dates as well as take steps to make it a bit easier for people to find the group.

So we'll be trying something on Tuesday, June 9 -- and members are certainly welcome to join in at any time depending on their schedules and exact gathering locations/times as described below. We'll let people know what we'll be wearing and other tips so it shouldn't be too hard to find us.


From 5:30-6 PM, please meet behind the stage where there will be some great free live jazz outside in Katz Plaza, at the corner of 7th and Penn Avenue (very close to the Benedum).  The free live jazz will run until 7 PM or so, so people have the option of staying at this location (and meeting the rest of the group later on) or walking with those that are interested to the next stop (see below)

From 6-7 PM, for those that are interested, we'll be walking from Katz Plaza and doing a short tour including some quick stops at a couple galleries and Gateway Center Artists Market.  If you can't meet the group before it leaves Katz Plaza at 6 PM, then please check out some things and plan to meet the group at 6:45 PM at the Gateway Center Fountain which is centrally located in the Artist Market and across from the Crazy Mocha.  So people have the option of staying at this location (and meeting the rest of the group later on) or walking with those that are interested to the next stop (see below)

At 7 PM, for those that are interested, we can walk over to Point State Park to check out the band The Felice Brothers http://www.3riversartsfest.org/fest_event/the-felice-brothers/  and http://www.thefelicebrothers.com/ as well as the Point State Park Artist Booths (along the periphery of the concert area) or get some food or walk to the Point from 7-8 PM.  

Anyone who arrives and hasn't met anyone yet should proceed underneath the Portal Bridge at either 7:30 PM or 8 PM sharp where there is a reflecting pool/public art display underneath the Portal Bridge which connects the main concert area to the Point (see the main photo above).


From 8-9:30 PM, we can check out the free concert Hurray for the Riff Raff http://www.3riversartsfest.org/fest_event/hurray-for-the-riff-raff/ as well as the Point State Park Artist Booths (along the periphery of the concert area) or get some food or walk to the Point.  Anyone who arrives and hasn't met anyone yet should proceed underneath the Portal Bridge at either 8 PM or 8:30 PM sharp where there is a reflecting pool/public art display underneath the Portal Bridge which connects the main concert area to the Point (see the main photo above).


Check out these articles about this year's Three Rivers Arts Festival http://triblive.com/aande/moreaande/8409435-74/june-festival-band#axzz3c0lJZ6Gc

http://www.pghcitypaper.com/pittsburgh/the-arts-festival-explores-the-theme-unseen-unheard/Content?oid=1830155


http://www.post-gazette.com/ae/music/2015/06/04/Dollar-Bank-Three-Rivers-Arts-Festival-Music-schedule/stories/201506040094

Of course as always, it is also fine if you prefer to attend the festival on your own with family/friends instead.


We should all remember that people have different work schedules and commuting times to downtown, so not everyone can arrive at exactly the same time. So we'll incorporate some flexibility in choosing some festival activities and times for meeting on various festival dates as well as take steps to make it a bit easier for people to find the group.

Of course as always, it is also fine if you prefer to attend the festival on your own with family/friends.

It looks like we'll have a nice Meetup group gathering for Monday June 8 where the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra will be performing with Pittsburgh Opera vocalists for free at Point State Park while the group can also check out nearby artist booths.  This would be nice event to attend and here are all the details if you'd like to RSVP http://www.meetup.com/Art-lovers/events/222480123/

With so many activities going on simultaneously each day during the Three Rivers Arts Festival, we've also added a Discussion Board forum for those that may wish to suggest some activities on a less formal basis. Please visit http://www.meetup.com/Art-lovers/messages/boards/thread/49004223/


For more information, including the history -- as well as this year's day-by-day 2015 schedule of the Three Rivers Arts Festival -- please visit http://www.3riversartsfest.org 

Meetup Gathering Locations & Times

5:30-6 PM -- Behind Stage for Live Jazz at Katz Plaza at corner of 7th & Penn

6:35-6:45 PM -- Gateway Center Fountain (within Gateway Center Artist Market)

7-7:10 PM -- in the middle of Point State Park at the public art installation "Black Rock Negative Energy Absorber" (See Photo and description) http://www.3riversartsfest.org/fest_event/black-rock-negative-energy-absorber-2/ From this spot, the group will choose an area closer to the stage where we'll be enjoying the concert

Back-up Spot Locations & Times -- where someone will  meet you instead and then take you to the concert area where the rest of the group is

7:30 PM and 8 PM --- Underneath Portal Bridge (between the concert area and the Point) at the public art installation "Confluence" (see photo and description) http://www.3riversartsfest.org/fest_event/fernando-orellana/

8:30 PM  -- in the middle of Point State Park at the public art installation "Black Rock Negative Energy Absorber" (See Photo and description) http://www.3riversartsfest.org/fest_event/black-rock-negative-energy-absorber-2/

Photo of public art installation "Black Rock Negative Energy Absorber" before it was moved to the middle of Point State Park 

Photo of public art installation "Confluence" underneath Portal Bridge (between the concert area and the Point)


Parking Here is the ParkPGH website with real-time info on downtown parking garage availability http://parkpgh.org  where you can also download apps, get garage availabilty via text messaging, etc. You can also call[masked]-8980.

Stay tuned for updates!

Jennifer Kwiecien, Certified Zentangle Teacher (CZT), leads this fun, welcoming group every Tuesday evening promptly from 6-7 pm (library closes at 7). Beginners are warmly welcomed.  Bring your own supplies, or use ones that Jennifer generously provides.  There is a "donations can" for anyone wishing to help support the ongoing costs for this meet-up and for supplies.

BONUS EXTRA:  On the first Tuesday of each month, some of us continue the evening's entertainment by going together to "The Moth" for live storytelling performances, at the Rex Theater, Southside, 8-10-ish pm, tix at door $8.

results.description:
Join us on Tuesdays for American Mah Jong! Folks begin arriving around 6PM, and we begin playing each table as soon as we have three or four players plus a set.  (We usually have 3-5 tables.)  We rotate among the tables... at the end of each game, East walks around to see if another table is close to the end of their game, so that two players can swap places. 


If you have never played, or if you have not played for a very long time, we highly recommend that you take a Mah Jong 101 beginner class before playing with us - beginner classes are offered every few months.  Mah jong is a wonderful game, but it's hard to learn by just watching others play!


Please order your 2015 card from the National Mah Jongg League, here: http://www.nationalmahjonggleague.org/ Amazon.com also carries the cards. Note that you want the NMJL card, and no other! (There are some colorful alternatives out there.. but we play NMJL card and rules.)

Experienced players -- please bring your cards and please bring a set if you have one.

Please do not bring any outside food or beverages into Panera! Instead, please plan to buy *something* from Panera, even if it's just a beverage or a cookie, to support their willingness to host us.
results.how_to_find_us: Hard to miss us, look for the Mah Jong sets!
results.name: Mah Jong in Shadyside! (Note:  We also have a beginner class tonight!)

results.description:
We will gather at 6PM, and I will introduce you to the tiles, the card, and the game.  We usually have time for two or three games.

Please try to arrive on time for this class!


You will not need your own Mah Jong card tonight.... but if you are going to continue playing, you should order a 2015 card! You do not need to buy a Mah Jong set - they are not inexpensive, and we have plenty of sets.


We can eat while I'm going through the basics, so feel free to grab some food when you arrive at Panera.

Let me know if you have any questions... you can easily contact me through the meetup group.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for Mah Jong tiles on the table!
results.name: Mah Jong 101 - intro for beginners

results.description:
Regular season weekly street skate.

Come tour the east end of Pittsburgh on our Tuesday Advanced One Hour Fitness Skate. Helmet and wrist guards required at a minimum. Must know how to brake, do curbs, skate around potholes, negotiate hills, manuever in street traffic, etc. We return after about 1 hour skating Oakland, Highland Park, Squirrel Hill, Bloomfield and other venues that takes us 5 – 8 miles up and down hills and on flat roadway.

 

We skate on the streets, parks, and trails for a great workout.  See you there! Patrolled skate. Be ready to roll by 6:30 PM.

 Cyclists are welcome to join us! Bike with us to enjoy an evening tour of the city. Also if you have not skated this meetup, biking is a good way to check it out.

NOTE: All skates are "weather permitting".  If it is dry we should be skating.

This is a traditional Hatha class taught with a vinyasa flow. We flow from one position to the next and focus on alignment, posture, breath, increased flexibility, strength, and balance. Class is held in the Keith Seminar Center upstairs at Dormont Library. It's private, has dimmer lights, carpet and we play music. I do the practice as I teach it. I tend to break a sweat and others do too, but it depends how much you put into it. The classes are usually 50/50 men and women. Lots of couples - couples, friends, sisters - attend. The class is donation-based. $5 donation is suggested.

All classes are from 7:00 – 8:00 pm.


Beginners are welcome.

$5 donation suggested.

Loaner mats available.

Visit: https://www.facebook.com/dormontyoga for more info. Hope to see you soon.

results.description:
Welcome to Iron City Aristacrats!

It's a new season and with it a new set of interesting technology topics at the Arista Pittsburgh Meetup Group. 

For the June 10th Meetup, we are going to talk about how big buffers are important at all layers of your network focusing on some very specific switch platforms with memory buffers to drive accelerated performance for applications such as IP storage, Media distribution, High Performance Computing (HPC), and Market Data Distribution. We will conclude with a live demo of these products running in a lab environment, and showcase some key features.

For a preview, check out this paper by Andy Bechtolsheim and the team at Arista:

http://www.arista.com/assets/data/pdf/Whitepapers/BigDataBigBuffers-WP.pdf 

Meetup Location:

For May , we're at the Pittsburgh Technology Council, 2000, Technology Dr, Pittsburgh, PA 15219. When you enter the PTC office, take a left and go all the way down the hall to the conference room. 

If you wish to send your full name to us privately so we can add you or guests on the list, join our meetup group and message us privately.

(drinks and pizza will be served)

Look for more updates or changes as the date approaches, and see you there.

Tony Williams 

(twilliams @ arista.com)

Chris Sharkey

(csharkey @ arista.com)
results.how_to_find_us: Contact us at 412-687-2700 or stop by the office at 2000, Technology Dr, Pittsburgh, PA 15219
results.name: Designing Spine & Leaf networks with Big Buffer switches.

Hi All,

We're meeting at 6:00 at the tennis court of Moon park and will play 2 hours or more.
If there are some people who want to play some tennis, please bring your racket and let's play together.

This is the event for all levels.
If you have any questions, please let me know.

Here is some guide I want to share with members. 


 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 TENNIS MEETUP RULES

1. Always RSVP before you come to the event. This helps in organizing and for reserving the courts. Note, without RSVP you may not have a spot.

2. If you RSVPed "Yes" and later decided to not come, please change the RSVP to "No" so the first member on the waiting list can get your spot.

3. Members are expected to arrive on time and stay for the duration. If you expect to be late more than 15 minutes, please send a text message to the posted organizer's phone number.

4. We will practice and always play a game - doubles or singles, depending on the number of members who come to the event.

5. The organizer will try to pair the teams based on skill levels but this may not always be possible and the pairing may be on a first-come-first-serve basis.

6. If a member is on the waiting list they can still come, however they may have to wait for courts to become available.
  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  Jason,
results.name: Wednesday evening tennis for all levels

results.description:
Join Network After Work on Wednesday June 10th at Steel Cactus (1831 E Carson St) from 6-9pm. Network After Work is America’s premier face-to-face business networking company with monthly mixer events in over 40 cities catering to nearly one million members. Attendees make valuable connections with other members of their business community while enjoying different exciting venues including clubs, restaurants, hotels and special event locations. Events attract a diverse mix of up to several hundred professionals from all industries and career levels. It all takes place on a weekday right after work in a fun and relaxed atmosphere conducive to making connections. Name-tags color coded by industries help sort through the many opportunities while a free drink and light bites before 7pm helps get the ball rolling right from the start.

Admission Includes: 
1. Access to 150 Professionals
2. Color-Coded Name Badge
3. First Featured Cocktail before 7pm
4. Light appetizers from 6-7pm
Admission: $15 in advance / $20 with RSVP at the door / $25 without RSVP

results.description:
See this event information at: http://www.gamemasterspgh.com/?tribe_events=deadlands-the-weird-west&eventDate=2015-03-11

This game is looking for players. "Deadlands: The Weird West" is a setting
where steam-powered jetpacks and zeppelins share space with cowboys,
sharp-eyed prospectors, and smoky desert saloons while inhuman
abominations and unsettling mysteries hide in every shadow.
 1876. The American Civil War has been going for 17 years with
no end in sight, and now being fought with steam-powered
tanks, flying machines, and man-portable Gatling rifles. The Quake of
 smashed California into a labyrinth of shattered plateaus and
treacherous rapids known as the "Great Maze", and the Sioux Nations
have reclaimed the Dakotas.
 Rumors have spread across the nation that the West is beset by
everything from giant, man-eating bats to the walking dead, and while
people in more civilized parts of the continent think  all
bunk,  mostly because the Union and Confederate governments
have done their best to hide the facts from them: truth is, magic and
monsters are very, very real, and there are larger forces behind their
sudden return.
 Anyone is free to join, regardless of prior experience: just walk in
and ask. I can be contacted through my e-mail or at[masked] (aim
for 11:30 AM to 5:30 PM) and am happy to help with character creation,
take suggestions on what mood or tone you would like to see in the
game, and answer questions.
results.name: Deadlands - The Weird West

results.description:
Come explore the Wildflower Reserve as we meander down the trails at a slower pace. Along the way, we will be guided by Shane Miller Park Educator, who specializes in botanical education. This walk will be less than 1 mile and focus on some the interesting plants within the Wildflower Reserve. Trail will include one hill going up and one hill going down with 200ft elevation change.

 Wildflower Reserve building photo courtesy of Friends of Raccoon Creek State Park

Wild geranium (Geranium maculatum) close up. Photo by David D. Taylor via USDA Forest Service web site

results.name: Midweek Walk (Interesting Plants)

results.description:
Hosted by: http://rebekahgambleholisticpractitioner.com/

Open Discussion Nights are donation based events SparkleDragon and I are bringing to the community once or twice a month in the interest of building community and public education. For the time that the event runs, I will be available to discuss a pre-chosen topic with you one on one and with whomever is in the group that evening.

This month we're going to have two. The first is on meditation and is held on the 9th. This is the second event the next night on the 10th. These events are very informal and consist of participants sitting together, having the space to share experiences and ask questions, and of course drinking tea, graciously provided by the Emporium.

This event is not a formal presentation, but I will be bringing many of my tools and work from the Andes to the event. You can pet a baby llama, see an alter piece, hold tools made by shamans in the jungle, take a look at photos, hold the leaves from a sacred plant and touch the feathers of the condor. I will also be talking about the things I've learned in the temples and sacred sites in Peru and Bolivia, including Coricancha, Saqsayhuaman, Machu Pichu, Ollantaytambo, Wiracocha, Tiahuanaco, Puma Punko, the Sacred Valley and the valley of Tinanjani. I will also be sharing my personal experiences with the healing of the Andean teachings, Coca leaf work, and Wachuma.

I met my second teacher in the Andean tradition for this work and he has authorized me to speak to you on these topics. His name is Jhaimy and you can contact him here if you wish to verify this information: https://www.facebook.com/jhaimy.alvarezacosta?fref=ts

I will share with you everything I can (because I love you!). My other qualifications in medicine ways don't matter, but if you're curious ask and I'll answer.

This event is being offered without charge in the interest of building a healthy community, but if you'd like to support my work and the shop, donations of $5 are happily accepted and are split between the two hosts.
results.name: Open Discussion: My Trip to Peru and Bolivia

results.description:
Regular season weekly Wednesday Start and Stop Clinic and organized street skates in Shadyside.

 

"FREE" Lessons start at 6:30 pm & the street skates start at 7:00 pm. If you need loaner skates, helmet, wrist guards for lessons please call [masked]) at least 2 days in advance or email at: [masked]

Two (2) street skates available:

Beginners Skate (7:15pm) is for those new to skating and having learned some of the basic skating and braking skills. Lasts about 45 minutes. Skate is on fairly level back streets of Shadyside with minimal traffic. This is a patrolled skate.

Advanced Beginners Skate (7:00pm) for those who can brake and skate with confidence and are ready to improve their skills. Ability to skate small hills and some street traffic. Skate lasts from about 1 to 1  1/2 hours. Skate route is generally from Shadyside to Oakland, Pitt, CMU and surrounding areas. This is a patrolled skate.

Helmets and wrist guards required as a minimum on all skates.

Occasional post skate tailgate gathering or walk to local eateries after the skate.

Note: All skates are weather permitting. If the streets are dry we should be skating!

Lessons are conducted by the National Skate Patrol.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet on a paved school yard, off street, fenced school yard area between Filbert and Ivy Streets along Ellsworth Ave. in Shadyside.
results.name: TRIC / NSP - Wednesday Beginners Skates & FREE Skate Lessons

The Build Guild is a simple thing. A regular gathering of web-folk with no commercial purposes. 

If you're a designer, developer, strategist, graphic artist, Dr. Horrible fan fiction site operator, project manager, information architect or even a hobbyist, come on out.

Talk web, design, industry topics, share some ideas, network and make professional connections, maybe pick up a freelance project or gig. Have a pint. Have 3 pints. Meet someone new. Play a game of darts.

We meet at the same place every month. Same time. Always the second Wednesday of the month.

results.description:
I've been to this a couple of times it's fun... Frank the Admin


The Pittsburgh Banjo Club is a non-profit organization made up of men and women from all walks of life, with a common goal - the encouragement and preservation of the banjo, America’s Native Instrument. Founded on December 15, 1988, by Frank Rossi, the Pittsburgh Banjo Club is dedicated to keeping the music of the Golden Age of the Banjo alive [masked]). Frank Rossi was inducted into the National Four-String Banjo Hall of Fame on May 24, 2001. The Banjo Hall of Fame is located at the American Banjo Museum in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma.

The Pittsburgh Banjo Club includes banjos, trumpets, tubas, and bass. Dressed in bright, colorful uniforms, the Pittsburgh Banjo Club makes a striking appearance while playing the happiest music in the world, putting a smile on your face, a tap in your toe and a song in your heart! The happiest sound in the world is a banjo and the Pittsburgh Banjo Club provides miles of smiles!

The Pittsburgh Banjo Club program consists of sing-alongs, vocals, banjo solos, music from the ’20s and ’30s, polkas and Dixieland.

results.description:
There are five enhancements that you can add to many tangle patterns for variety and extra complexity. We'll play with some familiar patterns, but make them new by adding these special touches.  Bring your usual supplies and sketchbook.

GENERAL INFORMATION

Beginners are always welcome.  (Beginners do not need to bring supplies; and will receive advice on buying supplies they may want to purchase locally or online.)

Group, meet-up membership and instruction are free; donations (suggested $2-5) to defray costs, however are welcomed.

Generally Sue Schneider, organizer, brings all supplies needed for projects/instruction.  (Additional supplies you may want to use at home are available for purchase.  If you have a specific request for official Zentangle products, kits, or tools, Sue will be happy to order them for you and deliver at the meet-up--you won't have to pay shipping costs!)

If you are a regular attender, simply bring your usual kit of supplies, and any other materials that may be specified for the particular session.

Fun, inspiration and good company are guaranteed!!

results.description:
Come out and meet some new people at my favorite local bar and restaurant.  You may be familiar with the location but not the name.  It was Montecello's, then it was Jabby Joe's and now it's Downey's House.  We'll be there from 5 - 8 pm on Thursday, June 11th (they have no problem getting people on Friday and Saturday) but we'll be welcome to stay later if we want.

Downey's has a full indoor bar and restaurant and a covered pavilion (full bar) out back with a pool table and 3 sets of cornhole boards.  They're known for having some of the best live music on weekends as well as the best pepperoni rolls in Pittsburgh.  Come find out why this is one of the most happening places in Robinson and meet some great new people in the process.

results.description:
Build a Biquad! Low-cost Directional WiFi Antenna Workshop

Come to The Hardware Store and learn how to build a highly-sensitive antenna on the cheap out of a panel of tin and some copper wire that will connect to a router with RP-SMA antenna connectors (those are the generally standard kind)! This style of antenna is highly directional and can shoot signal for hundreds of feet! If you want to connect two points far away from each other without spending an arm and a leg, this is the way to do it! These antennas will be specifically tuned for 2.4GHz. Similar antenna designs have been calculated to increase gain by 11dbi.


Our Instructor

Drew from Zhrodague is a 300-foot tall fire-breathing sysadmin, living at the top of the South Side Slopes. He is an amateur radio enthusiast who has built his own antennas for use in the 40 meter and 160 meter bands. Drew has contributed to O'Reilly books such as "Google Map Hacks" and has also taught other classes on building omnidirectional antennas for the 2.4 GHz band at Hack Pittsburgh. He’s worked with dorkbot, PittMesh, and with a few other local groups. When not toppling buildings, Drew works on many projects, including HAM radio, mesh networking, GIS systems, and recycled embedded computing projects.
results.name: [Workshop] Build a Directional WiFi Antenna

Enter from Ft Duquesne Blvd, and then take an elevator to the 10th floor. We will put up signs directing you appropriately from there, but it is a right off of the elevators.

A couple of house rules:
 - You must sign in which includes signing a waiver that you will not post pictures from inside of the 4moms offices
- No open flames/smoking
- Alcohol is for 21+ only
- You are allowed to bring food or beverage if you'd like, but you must provide all of your own paper products, dining ware, serve ware and utensils
- We are only allowed access to the student union. Specifically, please do not access the rear catwalk to 10S
- Please respect all safety protocol, to include but not limited to staying a respectable distance from the atrium, and no horseplay or rough housing

results.description:
This casual, a cappella singing group is primarily a way for experienced choristers to maintain their skills and to grow as musicians in a community of new friends. An ad-hoc vocal experience, Summer Sing is not intended as a performing group, but as a fun, weekly practice session until traditional choirs resume a regular rehearsal schedule.

Find out who likes this project by finding us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/Sommersingen


• Sing folk songs, canons, hymns, part-songs, madrigals
• Vocal improvisation will draw on collective creativity and individual flexibility
• Ear training and vocalizing with an emphasis on resonance and legato

Singers may participate for free with a donation to the Second United Presbyterian Church Food Bank: either bring 2 small bags of nutritious, nonperishable, easy to carry food items or bring 1 bag of food and $5 cash.

We will sing outside at the Second United Presbyterian Church of Wilkinsburg – the church adjoins a beautiful little neighborhood park with a sunny garden and big old shade trees. The church also hosts a free-play session in the park for kids and families each Thursday from 5:30 and 7:30, which makes for a nice "child-care by committee" environment – with free snow cones! Ample, free street parking is also available.

Key inspiration for this project comes from the teachings of Alice Parker and Ysaye Barnwell; aspirations from the recordings of Bobby McFerrin.
results.how_to_find_us: www.facebook.com/Sommersingen                         Second UP Church and the park are located at the end of Biddle Street, off of S. Braddock Avenue, near Frick Park and Regent Square.
results.name: Keep Singing the Summer!

Hi All,

We're meeting at 9:00 at the tennis court of Schenley park and will play 2 hours.
If there are some people who want to play some tennis, please bring your racket and let's play together.

This is the event for all levels.
If you have any questions, please let me know.

Here is some guide I want to share with members. 


 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 TENNIS MEETUP RULES

1. Always RSVP before you come to the event. This helps in organizing and for reserving the courts. Note, without RSVP you may not have a spot.

2. If you RSVPed "Yes" and later decided to not come, please change the RSVP to "No" so the first member on the waiting list can get your spot.

3. Members are expected to arrive on time and stay for the duration. If you expect to be late more than 15 minutes, please send a text message to the posted organizer's phone number.

4. We will practice and always play a game - doubles or singles, depending on the number of members who come to the event.

5. The organizer will try to pair the teams based on skill levels but this may not always be possible and the pairing may be on a first-come-first-serve basis.

6. If a member is on the waiting list they can still come, however they may have to wait for courts to become available.
  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  Jason,

Hosted by: Fran Treloar from SendOutCards and Maryann Liddle from Liddle Architectural Design

This is an informal networking event, open to any business woman who would like to increase her business contacts or clients in the Robinson/Airport area.

Things to bring:

- 10-20 business cards or marketing material

- cash for your lunch check

- $5 meeting fee (non members only)

AGENDA

1:00 pm - attendees arrive, reviews menu, gives the server their drink order, and open networking: everyone stands up to introduce oneself to others and pass their business card

1:15 pm - server takes lunch order and the sign in sheet is passed around

1:30 pm - 60 sec. commercials begin

2:00 pm - each person gives a testimony or referral for someone attending the lunch

2:30 pm - Premier member does a 5 min. company presentation

2:35 pm - WSBA announcements from Debi/Susan

2:45 pm - lunch has ended. Open networking is welcomed.

Be prepared to do a 60 second commercial about yourself. Please RSVP if you plan to attend this lunch. If your schedule becomes free the day of the lunch, then you may attend without an RSVP. This lunch is subject to cancellation when the lunch has 3 or less RSVPs.Lunch cancellation policy.

results.description:
$35/player - what a great deal for a 9 week league! Lots of people signing up to play - so should YOU! 

Sign up as an individual - great way to meet new friends! - with a group of friends or as a full team. 


Choose From:

Sunday Night (5-8pm) - Starts June 7th

Friday Night (6-11pm) – Starts June 12th

Provide 1st and 2nd choice for placement. 


What's included in the price? 


• 7 weeks of regular season + playoff tournament

• Certified referee

• 50 minute or 9 inning games

• Unlimited kicking rotation

• 10 players per team on field (5 female minimum)

• Championship t-shirts or trophies

• Food/Drink specials at sponsor bar

• We will not place more than 18 players on a roster. Most individual team rosters have 12-16 players.

Format  
10v10 ( Coed: 5 Males : 5 Females** you may have more than 5 females on the field at once, but this is the minimum requirement)

When are we playing?  
This league plays a round robin regular season with game times rotating from 6:00 PM through 8:00 PM. A full season schedule<a></a> and standings will be available on sportsmonster.net by week 2. 

Playing surface and what to wear:  
We play<a></a> outdoors on dirt and grass. Athletic shoes required, cleats recommended. Uniforms are encouraged but not required.

Level of competition:

- Recreational level is ideal for teams just looking for a good time!

These leagues are happening! Don't see a bunch of people registered here? Don't worry! Many people and teams register<a></a> directly on our sportsmonster.net website instead. So go ahead and sign up to play! 

Full Team Registration  
*Want to Register as a Full Team? -- If you want to register a full team, you can do so but roster size MUST be at least 18. And yes, you can pay for all 18 here. If players are signing up on their own, have each player/group be sure to reference one another so we know to place you together -- see questions when you RSVP. 

When will I find out which team I'm on?  
When we look at final numbers and see if you can get first or second choice of league, we will notify you with roster information. Once a team is formed, a roster will be provided to all the players and we ask someone from the team to volunteer to act as captain to ensure a full team is showing up each week and a positive vibe is maintained throughout the season. 

Don't have PayPal? You may register through Sportsmonster.net and pay by check or money order but you will be paying full value as presented on that site. 

If you have any questions please don't hesitate to ask.  
Call:[masked]
E-mail: [masked]

All registrations made through this Meetup event agree to the terms and conditions found on sportsmonster.net.

results.description:
Regular season Friday downtown weekly organized street and trail skate.

Intermediate skaters, helmet and wrist guards required at a minimum for our safety. 2+ hours skating of downtown, S.Side, North Shore, Strip District and other venues around downtown.  Trails, streets, bridges, stadiums, tunnels, Market Square, Station Square and more! See you there for a great tour of the city from the skaters perspective! And get a great workout.

Moderate pace. Urban skate. 10 to 16 miles. Mostly flat type terrain, but some gentler hills and sloped bridge decks and ramps may be encountered. Be able to maneuver in pedestrian and vehicular traffic, negotiate curbs, potholes, speed bumps and other urban amenities. Be able to brake confidently. This is a patrolled skate.

It is suggested that you wear light colored clothes, carry a flashlight, or wear blinkies, or reflective items.  Part of the skate will be completed as darkness is approaching.

Be ready to roll by 6:30 PM. Get there a little early to gear up and get ready to skate!

Frequent tailgate gatherings in the parking lot meeting place after the skate. And other post skate BBQ's, wine tastings, and other gatherings as the season progresses.

Come out and be part of the fun!

Cyclists are welcome to join us! Bike with us to enjoy an evening tour of the city. Also if you have not skated this meetup, biking is a good way to check it out.

NOTE: All skates are weather permitting. If it is dry we should be skating.

results.description:
Please join PICT Classic Theatre for a wonderful production of "How the Other Half Loves"  by Alan Ayckbourn. 


Three couples. Two houses. One stage. Similar to PICT’s 2011 production of "House and Garden" (also by Alan Aykbourn), "How the Other Half Loves" is a classic farce by the genius of English theatre. With all the complexities and confusions that every great comedy offers, we have a mixture of saints and sinners in a series of nefarious relationships. Experience humor at its finest as two dinner parties on different nights occur simultaneously, while all along the audience knows the secret that is causing the commotion.

Pittsburgh audiences have also seen many other plays by Alan Aykbourn, such as "Time of My Life" (Pittsburgh Public Theater, 2010) and "RolePlay" (Pittsburgh Public Theater, 2005)


Check out these nice articles and great reviews of "How the Other Half Loves" which are conveniently embedded within this link along with cast info, photos, video insights about the play, ticket availability, etc. http://www.picttheatre.org/play/half-loves/

Meetup Discount Tickets

To purchase discount tickets for the Friday June 12 performance with the online MEETUP30 discount code, please visit https://picttheatre.secure.force.com/ticket/#details_a0SU[masked]ZogMAE where you can also select your own seat.

Please note that the Meetup discount is $36 for advanced tickets ($30 + $6 handling) which is a nice savings as compared to the normal $54 price ($48 + $6 handling).

As always, it is also fine if you wish to attend the play (and get the discount) with family/friends instead.

Other Discount Options -- The Saturday evening 8 PM June 13 performance has a similar discount that is offered through the Goldstar discount ticketing company where people can get 50% off advance tickets plus $6.25 handling fee (per ticket) which equates to about $33 per ticket. So if anyone wants to pick out their own seats and get a discount for the Saturday June 13 evening performance, please feel free to consider this option -- and if you'd like, you could post some comments below as to the seat number you selected in case you'd like other members to try to meet you during intermission. For more info or to order advance tickets via Goldstar, please visit http://www.goldstar.com/events/pittsburgh-pa/how-the-other-half-loves-tickets

Please note that these discounts are not unlimited -- in other words, there is a limit on how many 50% off tickets Goldstar has access to for each show.

In case you're wondering, here is a listing of about 20 upcoming shows all over the Pittsburgh region where Goldstar has access to 50% discount tickets http://www.goldstar.com/pittsburgh/events/?page=3&mode=infinite In addition, Goldstar operates in many other cities. While Goldstar is certainly not a substitute for more traditional savings and benefits through the usual subscriptions or other discount offers (including what we can sometimes arrange for ourselves via Meetup), it is a relatively new option for Pittsburgh. 

FYI, here is a link with some background and FAQ about Goldstar, including links to articles about them from the New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Forbes, etc.  http://www.goldstar.com/company

Please note that Goldstar is free to join.

About the Play, PlCT Classic Theatre & Venue


Please note that this play is being staged inside the Stephen Foster Memorial which is the beautiful building next to the log cabin between the Cathedral of Learning and Schenley Plaza. Here is a link with the history and great photos of the Stephen Foster Memorial which also contains two theaters http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephen_Foster_Memorial

For more information about PICT Classic Theatre and this production, please visit www.picttheatre.org

And if you can't make the Friday June 12 show, please consider checking out one of the other performance dates during May 28 - June 13 as shown in the schedule below.

<a href="https://picttheatre.secure.force.com/ticket/#details_a0SU[masked]ZogMAE"></a> This play features a great cast/set and is directed by Martin Giles.  The play runs from May 28 - June 13, 2015. 

Don't miss this terrific show!

results.description:
Join us for a leisurely outing by kayak or canoe where you'll paddle pristine waters for approximately two hours. Please bring all necessary paddling equipment along with drinking water. PFD and sound device (whistle) are required. Ages 8 and up are welcome.


Thank you for your interest in our free "Sunrise Kayak or Canoe Outing." L.L.Bean has a new centralized reservation system. To guarantee your space, you must first confirm your reservation on our new centralized reservation system, and if appropriate, fill out a participant agreement. Please visit www.llbean.com/pittsburgh, find this event on the "Event Calendar", and register. We look forward to seeing you!


Activity Level:
Physical Ability/Cardiovascular Demand: Easy
Level of Experience: Intro

***Watercrafts & Supporting Equipment***
 This is an L.L.Bean "Outing", you're responsible to supply your own equipment. L.L.Bean does not currently rent watercrafts and/or supporting equipment.

Learn the skills for a lifetime of adventure:
 • L.L.Bean Outdoor Discovery Schools  LLBean.com/Adventure
</a>

What to bring:
Print, complete and sign an L.L.Bean participant agreement for each participant--> <a href="http://files.meetup.com/3349842/Participant_Agreement_Form_110514.pdf">Click Here


Required Items:
Kayak or Canoe
Personal Floatation Device (PFD)
Sound Device – pealess whistle works well
Closed toed shoes (no Flip Flops)

Recommended Items:
Camera*
Snacks
One-quart water bottle or hydration system, filled
Strap for glasses
Swimsuit and/or synthetic shorts or pants and top
Rainwear and/or nylon wind shell
Insect Repellent
Personal medications such as EpiPen or inhaler
Dry bag or Pelican case
Change of clothes and footwear for the ride home


*Electronic devices may become wet and should be stored in a dry bag or Pelican case.

Minimum Age 8: This outing is open to ages 8 and above. Children 8 to 14 years of age need to be accompanied by a participating adult. Children 15 to 17 years old can participate alone after their parent has signed the L.L.Bean participant agreement for minors.

Need help preparing for your next adventure? Visit L.L.Bean Store at Ross Park Mall and ask to speak with an Outdoor Product Specialist. L.L.Bean will fit you with the right clothing and gear for all of life's adventures.

L.L.Bean Store at Ross Park Mall
1000 Ross Park Mall Drive
Pittsburgh, PA  15237
Twitter
L.L.Bean Pittsburgh Outdoor Adventure Club on Meetup
L.L.Bean Outdoor Discovery School

results.description:
What:: GASP Games Day 
Where:: Springdale United Presbyterian Church 
When:: 10am to 11pm 
Cost:: $5 (first time attendees are free)

Due to our situation in finding a new home, Games Days are currently on a month-2-month schedule. See below for the schedule, it will be updated as needed.

2015 Dates 
January - cancelled without a replacement 
February 21st - Springdale United Presbyterian Church 
March 21st - Springdale United Presbyterian Church 
April - Could not secure a date in April (will hold 2 in May)
May 2nd and 23rd - Springdale United Presbyterian Church
June 13th - Springdale United Presbyterian Church
July - Location and date TBD 
August - Location and date TBD 
September - Location and date TBD 
October - Location and date TBD 
November - Location and date TBD 
December - Location and date TBD

The address for the church is located at the bottom of the page

Game Days run from 10am till 11pm, and are open to everyone. There is a small fee per person ($5) to attend Games Day, to cover the cost of the rental hall. This fee is waived for all first-time attendees. The fee will be collected when you arrive, and will grant access to all the games contributed by our members, for use that day. We will be holding off taking any new yearly payments, but those that did pay will be honored.

Speaking of games, there are always a multitude of board, card, role-playing, and miniature games being played on any given Game Day, but a few events are near constants. 
Our Multi-Player Magic League runs each Game Day, starting around 11am. It’s a league that runs Jan-Oct. There is a second league starting at 4:30PM with modified rules and decks, please read the forum post for more information. 
Several RPG campaigns are also run each Game Day, including our "One-Shot Saturdays", stand-alone adventures run by various GMs each month. 
There are several miniature games that regularly appear at each Game Day. These vary each month, but some examples are X-Wing, Lord of the Rings, Firestorm Armada, Dystopian Wars, Axis and Allies: War at Sea & Angels 20, BattleTech, AT-43, Infinity, and others. 
Don’t forget our extensive board game contingent. You can always find players for a board game, whether you bring your own or try out one of the many titles our BGers own and bring each month to our Games Library.

We ask that everyone attending our Game Days brings something along as a snack and/or drink, for the community to share in. The facility has a full kitchen, so items that need refrigerated are OK. Most people bring some soda, chips, cookies, veggie tray, etc. This helps everyone have a good time without worrying about snacks or drinks.

See you at Games Day!


Location Information:: 
Springdale United Presbyterian Church 
859 Pittsburgh Street 
Springdale, PA 15144

In this introductory-level class, participants will:

• Setup and configure the Arduino environment on their laptop.

• Read a dimmer

•  Control the color of an RGB LED

results.description:
Noire de … La (Black Girl)
Saturday, June 13th - 2:00 PM
Carnegie Library of Pittsburgh – Homewood
7101 Hamilton Ave., PGH, 15208
Doors Open: 1:00 PM Suggested Donation: $2
Refreshments Available

Ousmane Sembene's NOIRE de LA (BLACK GIRL)

Written & Directed by Ousmane Sembène
Country: Senegal Year: 1966 Length: 60 Minutes
B&W Language: French with English Subtitles

Website/Trailer: http://www.newyorkerfilms.com/Black-Girl-%28Noire-de,-La%29-%281965%29/1/90/
Winner of the Prix Jean Vigo, 1966 for Best Feature Film

DETAILS

Ousmane Sembène’s debut feature made a profound impression at international film festivals in 1966, and the evolution of African cinema can be dated from this point. Shot in a simple, New Wave style, it tells a bitter story of exile and despair. The heroine is a Senegalese maid taken to the Riviera by her employers. Once out of Africa she realizes what being African means: it means being a thing: “the black girl.” Sober and restrained, BLACK GIRL never loses sight of its central theme of the myth of decolonization. – New Yorker Films Black Girl is one of three films that complete the Sembene Film Festival's June programming.
results.name: Ousmane Sembene's Black Girl Headlines Sembene Film Festival's June Program

results.description:
Great Smokey Mountains Ride & Camp - Sunday, 6/14/15 to Friday 6/19/15.

Super slab it early to the mountains, a couple of good mountain days to destination, a day of rest/cushion, return on Thursday & Friday. Overnights at campgrounds with possible Day 2 stay at Francis Marion Hotel if they’re open and affordable - friendly to motorcycles, Black Rooster Restaurant next door, 27 beer taps. 

Thanks to Dan for mapping out routes that may be even better (see below). Thanks, Dan!

Day 1

 (294 miles, 6hrs 40 mins)- Waffle House Restaurant (430 Racetrack Rd, Washington,PA 15301) Morgantown, WV>Rt. 7 to Kingwood, WV>Rt. 72 to Parsons, WV>Rt. 219 to Marlinton,WV >Rt. 39 to Warm Springs>camp at Douthat State Park (http://www.dcr.virginia.gov/state-parks/douthat.shtml#general_information, address 14239 Douthat State Park Rd., Millboro, VA 24460; Ph:[masked]; Email:[masked]) 

Alt: http://goo.gl/maps/ewMHh


Day 2 

(192 miles, 4hrs 37 mins) - Douthat Rd. to Rt. 220/60 to Clifton Forge, continue a few miles (possibly on I-64W) to Rich Patch Rd. to Roaring Run Rd. to Craig Creek Rd. to New Castle>Rt. 42 to Newport>Rt. 460 to Pearisburg>Rt. 61 to Tazewell>Rt. 16 to Marion (this is Back of the Dragon; <a>www.backofthedragon.com)</a>>to Francis Marion Hotel (107 E. Main Street, Marion, VA 24354, <a>http://www.gfmhotel.com)</a>; or Hungry Mother State Park (http://www.dcr.virginia.gov/state-parks/hungry-mother.shtml#general_information) 

Alt: http://goo.gl/maps/E06Me


Day 3

 - (267 miles, 4hrs, 52 mins) Rt. 16 to Rt. 81 to Tail of the Dragon, 17555 Tapoco Road, Robbinsville, NC 28771, to Smokemont Campground, Smokemont Campground Road A, Cherokee, NC 28719

Alt: http://goo.gl/maps/w6t9k

Days 4 - 

relax, on your own, explore the locale, etc. 

Days 5 & 6

 - ride home over two days; scenic route adds only moderately to total time/distance (624 miles, 11hrs 35 mins) vs. direct super slab route (535 miles, 9hrs 12 mins) if we don’t need a contingency time. A couple of moderate 300 mile days; ride from about 8:00am to about 5:00pm allows time for morning coffee, generous rest stops and home for dinner.
results.name: Great Smokey Mountains Ride & Camp - 6 Days - Sunday, 6/14/15 to Friday 6/19/15.

results.description:
Join us for our weekly regular season Sunday Morning Social City Skate.

This is an intermediate level social skate of 10-15 mile, mostly flat route, with minor inclines at bridges, ramps and other similar areas. Enjoying the scenic views of the Southside, Strip District, downtown, Station Sq., Mexican War Streets and Northside.   An optional coffee stop is included near the end of the skate.

The intermediate skater should be comfortable skating in street traffic, braking on both flat and inclines and manueving curbs, pot holes, etc.    The steepest hills are the bridge decks and the 10-15 miles are at a relaxed paced.

This skate is a slightly more challenging then the Wednesday advanced beginner skate.

Skate will be led and patrolled by the National Skate Patrol.

Cyclists are welcome and encouraged to join. Also a good way to try the Sunday Skate route on your bike if you haven't skated it before.

Skate is weather permitting.  If it is dry we should be skating!
results.name: Sunday Morning Social City Skate.  9:00am to 11:30am

results.description:
Hi All,

We're meeting at 10:00AM at the tennis court of Moon park and will play 2 hours or more.
If there are some people who want to play some tennis, please bring your racket and let's play together.

This is the event for all levels.
If you have any questions, please let me know.

Here is some guide I want to share with members. 


 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 TENNIS MEETUP RULES

1. Always RSVP before you come to the event. This helps in organizing and for reserving the courts. Note, without RSVP you may not have a spot.

2. If you RSVPed "Yes" and later decided to not come, please change the RSVP to "No" so the first member on the waiting list can get your spot.

3. Members are expected to arrive on time and stay for the duration. If you expect to be late more than 15 minutes, please send a text message to the posted organizer's phone number.

4. We will practice and always play a game - doubles or singles, depending on the number of members who come to the event.

5. The organizer will try to pair the teams based on skill levels but this may not always be possible and the pairing may be on a first-come-first-serve basis.

6. If a member is on the waiting list they can still come, however they may have to wait for courts to become available.
  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  Jason,
results.name: Sunday morning tennis for all levels - Moon Park

results.description:
Please sign up if you're planning on playing and bring your favorite games!  Newbies are very welcome.  We have some great teachers to help you get started on your gaming adventure.  Let us know when you sign up what game(s) you'll be bringing.  On Sundays there is plenty of free parking on the side streets and even right on Murray.  Crazy Mocha serves great coffee, specialty drinks, snacks and pastries.  They do allow us to bring food in if we take our trash with us. We usually play all day, break for dinner around 6:00, then it's back to gaming until everybody poops out. 

Incidentally, many of our regular players no longer bother to sign up (but I really wish they would!), so if it looks like only  one or two people are coming, there could actually be quite a few more.  Remember, I will always cancel a game Meetup if we aren't gaming that day, so you won't be sitting there all by yourself waiting for a friend.    And please, remember to change your rsvp to no if you can't make it that day!

$1.00 will be charged to help cover the fee Meetup charges and to buy games for the group.  Join us and let the games begin!!!

results.description:
We love supporting new breweries, so when Big Rail Brewing out of the Grove City area contacted us about setting up a tasting event, we immediately said yes!

From Bill at BRB: "We have a small but mighty 2 bbl brewery that is currently being set up in the basement of the Harmony Inn in Harmony PA. Recently, our friends at North Country Brewing Co. in Slippery Rock reopened the Harmony Inn. They have asked Big Rail Brew to produce some of our own (and some house favorites) beer to go on tap at the Inn."

For this event, BRB will join a live acoustic musician on the Harmony Inn's outside patio to offer up free samples of their brews and to chat with us about their operation. The full bar and full food menu will be available inside. Also inside starting at 4pm will be another live band, so you may want to plan on sticking around for a while.

Since this event is so far in the future, I'm holding off on opening RSVPs until two weeks prior to the date, which puts us at 2:00 pm on Sunday, May 31. But mark your calendars now...you won't want to miss out on this awesome summertime event!

results.description:
Hi All,

We'll be working on Lesson 6 (remember to study your Kanji).  Please also remember finish up the assigned homework from the workbook.  If we don't get to it this week, we will definitely get to it next week.  Please be mindful of the conjugation of adjectives into adverbs.


い　adjectives => 　く　　わるい　ーー　わるく

な　adjectives =>   に　　しずかな　ーー　しずかに

If there is enough time, let's try to run through the quiz at the end of the chapter.

The text book for this class is Japanese for busy people book 2.
This class will be from 3:00 pm to 4: 00 pm.

Since I don't have a copy of the workbook I am hoping someone will bring it along if they have it.  We can work on Kanji practice and review the chapter and take the quiz.  

The location is the meeting room C of the Carnegie library squirrel hill.
Please RSVP and let me know if you have any questions.

Thanks!

Nick
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in Classrom C

results.description:
$39/player - What a deal for a fun summer of softball!

Sign up as an individual - great way to meet new friends! - with a group of friends - or as a full team. CHOOSE FROM:

Sunday - all day Coed (starts June 14th - )

Monday - Coed (starts June 15th, 2015)

Tuesday - Men's (starts June 16th, 2015)

Thursday - Coed (starts June 18th, 2015)

Friday - Coed (starts June 19th, 2015)

What's included in the price? 

• 7 game regular season plus playoff tournament (all teams get into playoffs)

• 7 innings or hour, whichever comes first

• Paid/trained umpire included

• Bases/Balls provided. You bring glove and team's favorite bat(s)

• Championship t-shirts/trophies!

• Food/Drink specials at sponsor bar

Format
Coed 6 men/4 women on field - no required batting order!

When are we playing?
This league plays a round robin regular season with game times rotating from first advertised start through the last. A full season schedule and standings will be available on sportsmonster.net by week 2. Playing surface and what to wear:
We play on grass fields. Cleats are suggested, shoes are required.

Levels of competition:

- Recreational level is ideal for teams just forming, teams with a mix of experienced and novice players and maybe teams that have lost a step or two over the years and are looking for a more relaxed environment. - Competitive level is geared for higher skilled players with more experience and looking to play with and against similarly skilled players. 

These leagues are happening!

Don't see a bunch of people registered here? Don't worry! Many people and teams register directly on our sportsmonster.net website instead. In fact, most of our Pittsburgh softball leagues SELL OUT! So go ahead and sign up to play! 

Full Team Registration
*Want to Register as a Full Team? -- If you want to register a full team, you can do so but roster size MUST be at least 15. And yes, you can pay for all of them here. If players are signing up on their own, have each player/group be sure to reference one another so we know to place you together -- see questions when you RSVP. 

When will I find out which team I'm on?
Once a team is formed, a roster will be provided to all the players and we ask someone from the team to volunteer to act as captain to ensure a full team is showing up each week and a positive vibe is maintained throughout the season. 

Don't want to pay online here? You may register through Sportsmonster.net and pay by check or money order but you will be paying full value as presented on that site. If you have any questions please don't hesitate to ask.
Call:[masked] 
E-mail: [masked]

All registrations made through this Meetup event agree to the terms and conditions found on sportsmonster.net.
results.how_to_find_us: Check in with Umpire
results.name: Play Summer Softball in the Burgh - $39/player

results.description:
Bi-monthly dinners bring together GlobalPittsburgh members and potential members. If you are not yet a member of GlobalPittsburgh but would like to share a meal and friendly conversation with our group, you are invited to join us for dinner once. To participate in our future events, we will expect you to join GlobalPittsburgh as a member at www.globalpittsburgh.org/membership so that you don’t miss any of our fun activities! 


If you RSVP "yes", you are expected to show up. Please consider this request seriously. Every guest is looking forward to meeting you if they see your positive RSVP. 

If you cancel your reservation later than 2 days prior to the gathering, you will be counted as a "no show". After 3 "no shows" we will, unfortunately, have to remove you from the group. It is all about respect to the other members and the restaurant staff who make our group dinners happen!

Our mission is to connect the Pittsburgh community with the people here from other countries through year-round activities and networking events.

tucked behind the Cost Center parking garage. We will aim for the turf
fields, but if those are taken, we can play on the grass fields out there.

Lets Start 4:30 pm
results.name: Sunday Pickup at the Pitt IM fields

results.description:
Ukulele players of all skill levels are invited to come and Jam at Hambone's Pub. Come to play ukulele, sing along, or even just to watch. We play from 5-7 pm.

Come earlier and sample Hambone's menu; meet other players over a beverage or just tune up. The beer is cold and the food is GREAT! Parking is free on Sundays and there is a small city lot across the street from Hambone's.

We are going to try a new format for this jam.  Rather than having a set playlist participants will choose songs from either of the "Daily Ukulele" books or from the song list that will be projected on the screen.  We will make every effort to insure that everyone has a clear view of the screen. 


We had a lot of fun using this format on the retreat so let's give it a try at Hambones.

I'm hoping fore a good turnout this Sunday.

Drew.


PS:   Sign up now to attend this "Jam."  See you at Hambone's.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be in Hambone's Dining Room (the door to the left)
results.name: 2nd Sunday Jams at Hambone's Pub

results.description:
Ahlain,

Let's start this week with some games and conversation practice! All levels are welcome, and beginners are encouraged to come at 6:00.  Our activities will help you learn the basics and more, and we will also work on conversational skills. 

Afterwards we'll practice reading in pairs or small groups. I'll have something for each level, but if you have something you want to work on, please bring it with you.

Hope to see you there!


Christine
results.name: Let's practice Arabic!

group.name: The Pittsburgh-Wexford Arabic Language Meetup Group

venue.address_2: ACROSS FROM PHIPPS IN BIG FIELD
venue.name: FlagStaff Hill

results.description:
During the Cinema in the Park season, every year there is a [Family friendly] Pillow Fight Mob!  The date has finally been set---so, let's plan on being there to capture the craziness live! 

The hill is large enough where we can observe the mob from a distance. Anyone wanting to practice quick gestures, movement, or simply observe a dynamic scene to inspire you, let's consider this unique event as an option.  And face it, with a rowdy bunch of artistes such as ourselves---we'll fit right into the mayhem!  

We'll meet at 600pm on flagstaff hill (across from Phipps Conservatory), which will give us a 2 hours to sketch before the crowds starts coming in for the pillow fight.  Feel free to come later if you are more interested in sketching the Pillow Fight Mob.    

The Mob is scheduled for ~820pm and will continue until the start of the movie.

The Free Movie in the Park afterwards will start at 9pm---which will Maleficent---for those interested in staying after to enjoy the show.  

Details for the event:

https://www.facebook.com/events/483443805137169/
results.name: Sketching a Pillow Fight Mob! @ Flagstaff Hill, Oakland

group.name: The Sketchbook Society of Southwestern Pennsylvania

results.description:
This is not a formal meetup. We share this information with you because it is a metaphysics event in Pittsburgh that you may enjoy attending.

Here the details about the event:

Sound Bath with Brooke Smokelin

Sound Baths are often referred to as “horizontal concerts” because everyone lies down on a yoga mat to enjoy the music and receive the vibrational healing. In this relaxed position and state of mind the transcendent sonic experience begins with the pure tones and overtones of quartz crystal singing bowls, creating a magnificent matrix of vibration to “recalibrate” the human energy system into a powerful place of resonance. Every cell of you and all the water within you begins to vibrate and eventually comes into harmony with everything around you- other people, a sense of place, a feeling of One-ness induced, restored, and supported by sound. Add to this the blissfulness of a flute, singing a song of truth and lightness so bright and clear you will be elevated into a new way of seeing and being. We often begin with the Spirit Drums and end with group free-form toning. It's quite magnificent! I hope you'll join us in the music....

Just relax, enjoy the sound bath, and receive.

Sliding scale $10- $20
results.name: Sound Bath - NOT A FORMAL MEETUP

results.description:
This is a Sunday night check-in for Monday's meetup. This gives you a chance to think about / work on your ideas and formulate questions before the Monday meetup.

Everyone is welcome - whether you just started working on a business idea or are a seasoned veteran with employees - we all learn from each other.
results.name: Discuss startup ideas - check-in for Monday meetup

results.description:
$59/player pricing - what a deal! Lots of people signing up - so should YOU! 

Sign up as an individual - great way to meet new friends! - with a group of friends or as a full team. 

Choose from one of the following:

-Sunday Night Coed  


-Monday Night Coed

-Monday Night Men's

Provide 1st and 2nd Choice when registering


What's included in the price? 


• 7 weeks of regular season plus up to two weeks of playoffs
• 2 friendly and certified referees per game
• 11v11 4 women on field minimum)
• Two 27-minute halves
• Championship t-shirts/trophies
• Food/Drink specials at sponsor bar
• We will not place more than 20 players on a roster. Most individual team rosters have 12-16 players.

Format
 11v11 (Coed: 7 Males: 4 Females** you may have more than 4 females on the field at once, but this is the minimum requirement)

When are we playing?
This league plays a round robin regular season with game times rotating from 7:00 on Sundays or Mondays. A full season schedule<a></a> and standings will be available on sportsmonster.net by week 2.


Playing surface and what to wear:
We play<a></a> on a turf field. Shin Guards are mandatory in all league games.


Level of competition:
- Recreational level is ideal for teams just forming, teams with a mix of experienced and novice players and maybe teams that have lost a step or two over the years and are looking for a more relaxed environment.

These leagues are happening!
Don't see a bunch of people registered here? Don't worry! Many people and teams register<a></a> directly on our sportsmonster.net website instead. So go ahead and sign up to play!


Full Team Registration<a></a>
*Want to register as a Full Team? -- If you want to register a full team, you can do so but roster size MUST be at least 18. And yes, you can pay for all 18 here. If players are signing up on their own, have each player/group be sure to reference one another so we know to place you together -- see questions when you RSVP.


When will I find out which team I'm on?
When more than one option is offered, you MUST be flexible and provide a 2nd choice. Once a team is formed, a roster will be provided to all the players and we ask someone from the team to volunteer to act as captain to ensure a full team is showing up each week and a positive vibe is maintained throughout the season.

Don't have PayPal? You may register through Sportsmonster.net and pay by check or money order but you will be paying full value as presented on that site.

If you have any questions please don't hesitate to ask.
Call:[masked]
E-mail: ryan @ sportsmonster.net


All registrations made through this Meetup event agree to the terms and conditions found on sportsmonster.net.

results.description:
Giant Pillow Fight at Schenley Park 9th Annual then Free Movie "Malificent"

Have a Vegan Picnic before the pillow fight and the movie. Just trying to keep things fun!
Pillow Fight is going on Rain or Shine. Mystery Signal is 8:20pm!

BYOP!(BRING YOUR OWN PILLOW!)

WE NEED HELP SPREADING THE WORD ABOUT THIS... tell friends!

FREE FUN! Wonderful! Silly! Kid-friendly and Adult-friendly Event!

DETAILS: 8:20pm SHARP! (the movie starts close to 9pm at Dusk) there will be a mystery signal and a GIANT PILLOW FIGHT WILL BREAK OUT! Kid Friendly, Bring your own Pillow! (BYOP!) Only allowed to attack others that have pillows! Amazing Fun! Last year we had 150+ people do this! 9th year doing this! Crazy video of previous pillow fight: http://www.wpxi.com/videos/entertainment/raw-video-hundreds-pillow-fight-in-schenley-park/vDBFZ/

DAY: Sunday, June 14th

TIME: 8:20pm SHARP! MYSTERY SIGNAL at 8:30pm SHARP! Then the Pillow War Begins ;-)

Where: Schenley Park Flagstaff Hill,

YOU WILL SEE SOMEONE WITH A ORANGE BICYCLE FLAG on a Stick to gather around!

Address: Corner of Schenley Drive and Frew Street then up the Hill by where they are showing the movie on the right hand side as you go up the HILL!

COST: FREE just bring a pillow! BYOP!

Quick description of Event: This is the 9th annual giant pillow fight. Show up in Pajamas or in cool comfortable clothes.

ADVICE: SHOW UP EARLY at 8:00 pm, BRING A PILLOW! At 8:20pm SHARP! a MYSTERY SIGNAL will sound and then ATTACK anyone with a pillow! (NO ATTACKING UNARMED CIVILIANS!) Have fun! be silly don't hurt people.

PS. Watch out for Lil Kids! They are Dangerous Lil Buggers! Be Safe! Soft Pillows Preferred!

SPECIAL NOTE: If anyone DROPS their Pillow you cannot attack them! Also BE CAREFUL with hitting peoples heads with Pillows! If you see people going to hard at this where it might hurt someone: "STOP THEM!"(We self police and this will be mentioned before we start!) This is Exhaustingly FUN! We will be done a lil bit before the movie. 10 to 15 minutes of PILLOW FIGHTING and then the movie or whatever you want to do! AFTER WE CLEAN UP ANY MESS!

Afterwards either watch the FREE MOVIE in the PARK which is "MALIFICENT" or go on your own way or go to a local watering hole.

WE NEED HELP SPREADING THE WORD ABOUT THIS... just tell some friends and ask them to tell theirs. It's usually about[masked] people and FUN! FOUR years ago we got on Channel 11 TV. Probably won't be on TV but will still be fun anyhow.

FYI: This is a flashmob but it isn't. Just people asserting their right to carry and use pillows. ;-)

Facebook Event: https://www.facebook.com/events/483443805137169/

Free & Almost Free Meetup Event: http://www.meetup.com/pittsburgh-free/events/222663396/
results.name: Giant Pillow Fight! 9th Annual! then free movie: "Malificent!" Kid Friendly!

results.description:
Summer schedule for FREE movies in the park is out. Share if you want!

Movies start at DUSK! (around 9pm then it gets earlier toward August)

Remember there are other parks that have the same movies on different days: Arsenal Park, Mt. Washington Grandview Park, Overlook Park in the West end, Brookline, Highland Park, Riverview Park and more...

http://pittsburghpa.gov/citiparks/cinema-schenley

ALSO GO TO FREE & ALMOST FREE IN PITTSBURGH for FREE CONCERT info for Hartwood Acres, South Park, Greensburg, Butler! http://www.meetup.com/pittsburgh-free/

results.description:
2 Rules for the meet up:

1) No solicitation of services *cool if someone comes to you but consultants/lawyers/coaches beware, any sales pitches and you'll have to find a new Monday ritual

2) Make sure to state whether what you are saying is an opinion or fact (both very much welcome) so to not confuse anyone about where the point of view comes from

Location change: Repair The World - 6022 Broad St. (Around the corner from Zeke's Coffee - grab your coffee from there and head over)

Share or listen to ideas but don't be fooled this is not startup therapy or feeding the ego this is about getting to work and removing the obstacles to make your idea a reality.

All entrepreneurs are welcome and it's not uncommon for us to have musicians, artists, chefs, writers, developers, renovators, or just about anyone else you can think of join the conversation.

After meeting outside Repair the World / Alpha Lab Gear / Thrill Mill, we adjourn to a local coffee shop, public space or outdoor park depending on weather, preference and group size.

If you’re attending, check-in on the Sunday conference Call, RSVP here, let me know at another meetup or email me at [masked] so we’re sure to gather everyone.

This meetup is run by an experienced entrepreneur who started a business, ran it for over 20 years and successfully exited to a public company. He now keeps busy mentoring for a nationally recognized accelerator, reviewing business plans/pitches for investors and consulting for businesses & non-profits. When asked “why do a metope?” he says he is looking to “pay it forward” by helping people make less mistakes than he made.

results.description:
Every month, Awesome Pittsburgh trustees award one $1,000 grant to a project that will make Pittsburgh a more awesome place. The selection process has always happened behind closed doors... until now!

On June 15, we invite you to help us pick our next grant winner at a live pitch party! We've narrowed the field and invited four finalists to pitch before a live audience, guest judges from Braddock, and the Awesome Pittsburgh trustees. Questions and feedback from trustees and guest judges will give applicants and attendees an inside look at how grant decisions are made each month.

In addition to the pitch competition, guests will have a chance to hear from recent Awesome Pittsburgh grant winners and mingle with the many Pittsburghers doing awesome work around the area, including our awesome Braddock superstar judges: Ms. Phyllis Brown, Ms. Gisele Fetterman, Mr. Patrick Jordan, and Mr. Kevin Sousa.

RSVP via Eventbrite today and join us at The Brew Gentlemen Beer Co.! The Pgh Taco Truck will be there, the Gents' beer will also be available for purchase, and dessert from Iron Oven is on us! This event is free and open to the public.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/awesome-pitch-burgh-party-awesome-in-braddock-tickets-17144331156

results.description: We begin the science portion of this series by stating a simple fact: for most of us, life is seemingly always in turmoil. But would you believe that underlying it all is actually organization and order? There is a scientific concept that is a perfect place to start our journey - chaos theory - which holds within it the scientific backing for Matthew 17:20 ("Faith the size of a mustard seed can move a mountain."), and the best way man has ever figured out how to handle chaos - oxygen. In this group we will process fascinating concepts such as the butterfly effect and fractals as well as the science behind Buddha's best advice - take a deep breath!

Some people who come have never even held a ukulele, and if you contact Sandy ahead of time, she will bring an extra ukulele for you to try. Try it -- it's fun!

Snacks and libations to share are welcome.

For more information, contact Sandy at [masked]

Directions to the Church: Take I279 North to Wexford exit. Turn right at the end of the exit. Right at the light onto Brandt School Road. Right onto West Ingomar Road to 2359. Note - watch for the large sign for the Church and then you will follow a narrow roadway back through the trees to the Church.

results.description:
Hi All,

We're meeting at 7:30 at the tennis court of Schenley park and will play 2 hours or more.
If there are some people who want to play some tennis, please bring your racket and let's play together.

This is the event for all levels.
If you have any questions, please let me know.

Here is some guide I want to share with members. 


 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 TENNIS MEETUP RULES

1. Always RSVP before you come to the event. This helps in organizing and for reserving the courts. Note, without RSVP you may not have a spot.

2. If you RSVPed "Yes" and later decided to not come, please change the RSVP to "No" so the first member on the waiting list can get your spot.

3. Members are expected to arrive on time and stay for the duration. If you expect to be late more than 15 minutes, please send a text message to the posted organizer's phone number.

4. We will practice and always play a game - doubles or singles, depending on the number of members who come to the event.

5. The organizer will try to pair the teams based on skill levels but this may not always be possible and the pairing may be on a first-come-first-serve basis.

6. If a member is on the waiting list they can still come, however they may have to wait for courts to become available.
  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  Jason,
results.name: Monday evening tennis for all levels.

results.description:
THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY.  TIME OF WEB CONFERENCE LOCALLY IS BASED ON LIVE-STREAM START - PACIFIC DAYLIGHT TIME. DETAILS TO CONNECT TO LIVE-STREAM ARE INDICATED BELOW. 

Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.

Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more. 

Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does.  Emphatically.That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value.

On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including:
  Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science
•  Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize
•   Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science
•   Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus
•   Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM
•   Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

Live Streaming Link:

To get additional details about Spark you can sign up now for a reminder at:

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Scroll down to "Can't attend in Person"?  Sign up for a reminder and add it to your calendar.

Additional information on Spark:

Link to Spark Fundamentals Course in Big Data University

http://bigdatauniversity.com/bdu-wp/bdu-course/spark-fundamentals/

Link to Spark Technology Information

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Happy Sparking.
results.name: IBM | Spark - The start of something big in data & design (Web Conference Only)

results.description:
Join us on Tuesdays for American Mah Jong! Folks begin arriving around 6PM, and we begin playing each table as soon as we have three or four players plus a set.  (We usually have 3-5 tables.)  We rotate among the tables... at the end of each game, East walks around to see if another table is close to the end of their game, so that two players can swap places. 


If you have never played, or if you have not played for a very long time, we highly recommend that you take a Mah Jong 101 beginner class before playing with us - beginner classes are offered every few months.  Mah jong is a wonderful game, but it's hard to learn by just watching others play!


Please order your 2015 card from the National Mah Jongg League, here: http://www.nationalmahjonggleague.org/ Amazon.com also carries the cards. Note that you want the NMJL card, and no other! (There are some colorful alternatives out there.. but we play NMJL card and rules.)

Experienced players -- please bring your cards and please bring a set if you have one.

Please do not bring any outside food or beverages into Panera! Instead, please plan to buy *something* from Panera, even if it's just a beverage or a cookie, to support their willingness to host us.
results.how_to_find_us: Hard to miss us, look for the Mah Jong sets!
